channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Pénurie de cartes graphiques : c’est une « bonne idée », Nvidia confirme envisager le retour des anciennes GeForce
item.description: Alors que la pénurie de mémoire frappe le CES 2026 de plein fouet, le patron de Nvidia confirme les rumeurs : ressortir les anciennes GeForce est une « bonne idée ». Oui, la RTX 3060 pourrait bien faire son grand retour, mais avec un twist inattendu.

item.title: What's Going on With Smart Rings?
item.description: Ultrahuman smart rings currently can’t be sold in the US. We caught up with the company’s chief business officer to discuss what’s next for ring-based health tracking.

item.title: Voici les grands perdants et les gagnants de la réforme solaire en France au 1er trimestre 2026
item.description: Si de fortes baisses ont été appliquées l’an dernier aux dispositifs d’aide à l’installation de panneaux solaires, ce premier trimestre 2026, les montants sont maintenus stables pour les installations résidentielles en France. Pour les systèmes de plus forte puissance, en revanche, la tendance à la baisse se poursuit. Voici les détails.

item.title: Discord’s IPO could happen in March
item.description: Discord reportedly filed confidential IPO paperwork and has pinned its hopes on a debut in March.

item.title: Shopify competitor Swap raises $100M six months after raising $40M
item.description: VC firms DST Global and Iconiq are piling into e-commerce startup Swap Commerce, which is going up against Shopify.

item.title: Smart Glasses With ‘Pet Translation’ Smell Like Total BS
item.description: There's vaporware, and then there's this.

item.title: Growth, not efficiency, is the new AI goal
item.description: ITDMs aren't too worried about productivity – they think AI's true value is in unlocking extra revenue and innovation.

item.title: The Shine 2.0 is a compact wind turbine for your next camping trip
item.description: As power gets more dicey, personal energy generation only gets more appealing. Shine’s compact turbine isn’t going to power your house any time soon (though the company’s co-founder told me they have plans in that direction) but it can suck up the energy required to refill a smartphone in as little as 17 minutes. Of course, what it can generate depends on wind speed. That same charge could take as long as 11 hours if there’s only a slight breeze. That power curve, and its ability to operate at night, sets the turbine apart from solar panels. Of course, on a completely still day, the Shine as ...

item.title: ASUS and XREAL teamed up at CES to make gaming smartglasses with two important upgrades
item.description: The latest generation of smartglasses can create huge virtual screens without the need to lug around giant monitors are a real boon to frequent travelers. However, their specs aren’t often tailored to the needs of gamers, so at CES 2026, ASUS and XREAL partnered to make a pair with two very important features you don’t normally get from rivals. The new ROG XREAL R1 AR glasses are based on the existing XREAL One Pro, so naturally they share a lot of the same components and specs including dual micro-OLED displays with a per-eye resolution of 1,920 x 1,080, three degrees of freedom (natively), 7...

item.title: Ne parlez plus de robots : l’industrie a honte de ce mot, alors elle a inventé « Physical AI »
item.description: Au CES 2026, le mot "robot" est devenu tabou. À la place ? Tout le monde parle de Physical AI. Une simple pirouette pour nous vendre des aspirateurs et des humanoïdes sans faire peur ? Pas seulement. Derrière ce changement de nom, il y a une vraie révolution technique pilotée par Nvidia.

item.title: Samsung’s Ballie robot is probably never coming out
item.description: Samsung's spherical Ballie robot may be rolling off into the sunset, less than a year after its retail launch was announced. The smart home robot has made an appearance at CES almost every year since it was first announced in 2020, but was notably absent at CES 2026. Unfortunately, its disappearance may be because Ballie […]

item.title: Poison-Laced Arrows Date Back Tens of Thousands of Years Earlier Than Expected
item.description: The use of poisoned weapons 60,000 years ago would have required big brain power.

item.title: Our Latest Look at ‘The Mandalorian and Grogu’ Sure Is a Picture of the Mandalorian and Grogu
item.description: As we wait for a second trailer for the upcoming 'Star Wars' movie, a new photo has arrived.

item.title: AI Models Are Starting to Learn by Asking Themselves Questions
item.description: An AI model that learns without human input—by posing interesting queries for itself—might point the way to superintelligence.

item.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT Health, encouraging users to connect their medical records
item.description: OpenAI has been dropping hints this week about AI's role as a "healthcare ally" - and today, the company is announcing a product to go along with that idea: ChatGPT Health. ChatGPT Health is a sandboxed tab within ChatGPT that's designed for users to ask their health-related questions in what it describes as a more […]

item.title: The psychology of the ‘Chicken Little’ coworker
item.description: For some, a sudden catch-up invite with the boss equates to ‘I’m getting fired.’ Why—and what gets us out of the mental trap? Everybody knows this coworker—the one who spirals about cost-cutting layoffs when snacks vanish from the break room. The one who thinks they’re getting fired because their boss hasn’t been using emojis with them lately. The one who’s the office Chicken Little: anxious, somewhat frantic, often misguided . . . and who can’t stop talking to others about whatever it is they’re anxious about....

item.title: Job openings drop to 2nd lowest level in 5 years in November
item.description: The number of job postings in November was the fewest since September 2024. U.S. employers posted far fewer jobs in November than the previous month, a sign that employers aren’t yet ramping up hiring even as growth has picked up.

item.title: Les 3 meilleurs écouteurs Bluetooth de 2025, testés et approuvés
item.description: L'année 2025 a été un excellent millésime pour les écouteurs et les casques. Entre des mises à jour très attendues et de nouveaux produits qui cassent les prix, les sorties étaient nombreuses. Nous avons testé moult modèles en 2025 : voici les trois références d'écouteurs sans fil qui se sont démarquées.

item.title: AMD says its Instinct MI500 AI Accelerator will come in 2027 — but is it too late with Nvidia set to introduce Vera-Rubin in 2026?
item.description: AMD details Instinct MI500 architecture and memory plans ahead of the AI accelerator's 2027 debut.

item.title: Brunswick's latest boats at CES 2026 feature edge AI, self-docking capabilities and solar power
item.description: If you've never docked a boat before, consider yourself lucky. There are plenty of popular TikTok channels devoted to shaming those who bring their craft back home clumsily or berth them with something less than finesse. Tricky crosswinds, unpredictable surf and even the jeers of passersby can make it a stressful experience at the best of times.Brunswick, which owns more than 50 water-borne brands like Sea Ray, Bayliner and Mercury Marine, has a solution. It's demonstrating some self-docking tech called AutoCaptain at CES 2026 that makes this process a cinch, plus a fleet of other innovations ...

item.title: Where VCs think AI startups can win, even with OpenAI in the game
item.description: Vanessa Larco, partner at Premise and former partner at NEA, thinks 2026 will finally be the year of consumer AI. Larco, who’s been investing in consumer and prosumer for years, thinks we’re about to see a shift in how consumers spend time online, with AI powering “concierge-like” services. The question is, will legacy consumer products like WebMD and […]...

item.title: Average organization now reporting over 200 GenAI-related data policy violations each month
item.description: Shadow AI remains a key challenge for organizations as employees share more and more sensitive data with unvetted tools.

item.title: Niko is a robotic lift for people with limited mobility that doesn't require a caregiver's help
item.description: A startup called ReviMo has developed a robotic system that provides a way for people with limited mobility to lift and transfer themselves — like from a bed to a wheelchair, or to the toilet — without the assistance of a caregiver. ReviMo's Niko has two sets of arms: one that forms a "scooping seat" that slides underneath the person to lift them up, and the other encircling their torso and providing a backrest. It can be operated both by remote and using the controls on its dashboard. Niko in its current iteration can carry up to 250 pounds, but the team says it's working on a version that ca...

item.title: Ikea au CES 2026 : enfin du Matter natif pour ses lampes design, mais à quoi ça sert à quoi au juste ?
item.description: C'est le mot d'ordre du CES 2026 : l'interopérabilité. Ikea l'a bien compris et met à jour sa gamme Varmblixt. Au menu : une lampe de table et une suspension qui embrassent enfin le standard Matter.

item.title: Anthropic reportedly raising $10B at $350B valuation
item.description: Anthropic is reportedly in talks to raise $10 billion at a $350 billion valuation, marking its third mega-round in a year.

item.title: Amazon’s smart shopping cart for Whole Foods gets bigger, lighter, and adds tap-to-pay
item.description: Amazon is launching a revamped version of its smart shopping cart, which it plans to bring to dozens of Whole Foods locations by the end of this year, according to an announcement on Wednesday. The new Dash Cart features a "more responsive" item scanner that's now located next to the built-in display, along with a […]

item.title: Ubisoft is shutting down a studio 16 days after it unionized
item.description: Ubisoft is closing a Canadian studio just over two weeks after it unionized. In a dizzying claim, the company told GamesIndustry.biz that the closure of Ubisoft Halifax was part of "company-wide actions to streamline operations" and unrelated to the unionization.On December 22, Ubisoft Halifax announced that 61 of its workers had joined the Game & Media Workers Guild of Canada. At the time, the studio's lead programmer, Jon Huffman, told CTV News that 73.8 percent of employees voted in favor of unionizing. Ominously in hindsight, he had described the decision as a "huge relief." The studio was...

item.title: Fujifilm’s new instant camera captures video with vintage effects
item.description: Fujifilm is expanding its hybrid instant camera line with the new Instax Mini Evo Cinema that adds the ability to capture video clips up to 15 seconds long. The Mini Evo Cinema also features a unique design inspired by the vintage Fujica Single-8 8mm film camera that Fujifilm introduced in 1965. It will be released […]

item.title: Some of our favorite 4K UHD Blu-rays are three for $33 at Amazon right now
item.description: The holidays — and the copious amounts of binge-watching that come with them — are very much behind us at this point, but that doesn’t mean there won’t be time to catch up on the movies from last year (and beyond) you might have missed. Thankfully, Amazon has brought back one of the better promos […]

item.title: LG's CLOiD robot can fold laundry and serve food… very slowly
item.description: When LG announced that it would demo a laundry-folding, chore-doing robot at CES 2026, I was immediately intrigued. For years, I've wandered the Las Vegas Convention Center halls and wondered when someone might create a robot that can tackle the mundane but useful tasks I despise like folding laundry. With CLOiD (pronounced like "Floyd"), LG has proven that this is theoretically possible, but probably not likely to happen any time soon. I went to the company's CES booth to watch its demonstration of CLOiD's abilities, which also include serving food, fetching objects and fitness coaching. Duri...

item.title: Nikon's affordable travel zoom looks like a no-brainer for full-frame first timers – here's what it can do
item.description: Nikon has unveiled the Nikkor Z 24-105mm f/4-7.1 zoom lens for full-frame cameras, and it's available as a kit with the new Nikon Z5 II.

item.title: Everything announced at CES 2026
item.description: It's the first week of a new year and there's no time for the tech world to slowly ease back into things following the holidays. That's because CES 2026 is in full swing, with all manner of companies descending on Las Vegas to reveal their latest innovations and what they're planning to bring your way in the near future. Many of the Engadget crew are on the ground to check out as much of the new tech as possible. Of course, we're keeping tabs on all of the major CES press conferences too. Samsung held its First Look presentation, which focuses on home products, while LG has shown off a wide ar...

item.title: Some ‘Stranger Things’ Fans Have Built an Elaborate Delusion Around a Secret ‘True’ Finale
item.description: Nicknamed 'Conformity Gate,' the conspiracy theory rabbit hole goes deep but ultimately leads nowhere.

item.title: Skylight debuts Calendar 2 to keep your family organized
item.description: Skylight, known for its digital picture frame, has a new digital product that puts software and AI at the center.

item.title: Dell admits consumers don’t care about AI PCs
item.description: Dell has revealed that consumers aren't buying PCs for AI features right now. In an interview with PC Gamer ahead of CES, Dell has made it clear its 2026 products aren't all about being AI-first, and it's moving beyond being "all about" AI PCs. "We're very focused on delivering upon the AI capabilities of a […]

item.title: RFK Jr’s Food Pyramid Announcement Interrupted by His Quacking Ringtone
item.description: It was a little on the nose.

item.title: Grosse panne chez Logitech : pourquoi vos périphériques Mac plantent et comment régler le problème
item.description: Depuis hier, les utilisateurs de périphériques Logitech sur macOS font face à un blocage complet des logiciels de configuration de la marque. Une mise à jour corrective vient d'être déployée pour rétablir la connexion avec vos souris et claviers.

item.title: Google Classroom’s new tool uses Gemini to transform lessons into podcast episodes
item.description: Google Classroom now offers a Gemini-powered tool that generates podcast-style audio lessons for teachers to deepen engagement with students.

item.title: Acer debuted 3 new gaming monitors at CES 2026 — should you upgrade?
item.description: Acer announced three new gaming monitors at CES 2026 on Monday. Here are the specs of each, as well as when they'll be available.

item.title: Here's how to claim a refund up to $52 from Amazon for its Prime settlement – and how to check if you're eligible for one
item.description: The total FTC settlement will total $2.5 billion, so here's how to get your share of the pie.

item.title: Segway launches two more e-bikes at CES
item.description: I’m no psychologist, but I get a sense Segway turned up to CES 2026 with something to prove after last year. Certainly, it’s gone out of its way to prove its micromobility bona fides with the press, who perhaps were a bit too sniffy that scooter people were launching an e-bike. This year, Segway’s not just launching two more mainstream e-bikes, but an electric dirt bike, all of which are crammed with the sort of tech that might just make everyone halt their sniffiness.First up, there’s the Myon, a chunky step-through with a decent-sized pannier rack for folks who want to go far and carry a bit...

item.title: Xgimi’s New AI-First Smart Glasses Will Come in Three Tiers
item.description: All three feature multiple AI assistants.

item.title: Elon Musk’s xAI Just Raised $20 Billion While Grok Churns Out Sexual Deepfakes
item.description: During a a recent review, Grok generated thousands of sexually suggestive AI images per hour, according to a deepfake researcher.

item.title: These robotic sneakers gave me a surprising boost at CES
item.description: I'll admit that I've always kind of taken walking for granted. Other than a knee injury more than a decade ago, my ability to walk long distances has largely been limited only by my own choices. That's not the case for everyone, though. And robotics company Dephy has created a pair of robotic sneakers, called the Sidekick, that are meant to help people who want to walk more than their bodies might otherwise be capable of.The system consists of two parts: an ankle-worn exoskeleton and a special pair of sneakers that attach to it. The exoskeleton hooks onto the back of the shoe and is secured wi...

item.title: Spotify now lets you share what you’re listening to in real time via chat
item.description: Spotify is rolling out more social features to keep people on the platform. It's adding a new tool to its messaging platform that lets users see what their friends and family members are listening to in real time. Once activated, a user's listening activity will be displayed at the top of the chat. The other person in the chat can tap the bar to play a particular track, save it or react with an emoji. People can also, of course, comment directly to either praise or rag on the song selection. There's another little addition to Spotify's messaging system. Users will now be able to invite chat pa...

item.title: Lenovo : après Windows 11, la Legion Go 2 arrive aussi sous SteamOS
item.description: Lenovo ne veut pas enfermer ses consoles portables dans le carcan d'un seul système d'exploitation. Histoire de ne pas faire de jaloux (et de s'aménager une porte de sortie au cas où), le constructeur mise aussi bien sur Windows 11 que sur SteamOS — ce dernier va ainsi équiper la Legion Go 2, modèle le plus haut de gamme au catalogue qui tourne uniquement sur Windows pour le moment....

item.title: Hisense, une gamme complète de TV RGB MiniLED en 2026, mais aussi des TV LCD Mini LED et Direct LED, tous les détails
item.description: C’était écris, Hisense a profité du CES 2026 pour présenter plusieurs séries de téléviseurs utilisant sa nouvelle technologie de rétroéclairage RGB MiniLED. En plus, la marque devrait proposer d’autres gammes de TV embarquant une dalle Mini LED, plus classiques, mais pas inintéressantes.

item.title: La Nasa sauvée par le Congrès, mais contrainte de renoncer à un rêve martien
item.description: Après des mois de grandes déclarations et de menaces de la part de Donald Trump, la plupart des velléités du président américain ont finalement été mises de côté, et la Nasa s'en sort quasiment indemne… Même si quelques ajustements sont de mise.

item.title: It’s the first anniversary of the L.A. wildfires. Why have less than a dozen homes been rebuilt since then?
item.description: The Palisades and Eaton fires tore through the Los Angeles area on Jan. 7, 2025, killing 31 people and destroying nearly 13,000 properties. On the first anniversary of the most destructive wildfires in the L.A. area, the scant home construction projects stand out among the still mostly flattened landscapes.Fewer than a dozen homes have been rebuilt in Los Angeles County since Jan. 7, 2025, when the Palisades and Eaton fires erupted, killing 31 people and destroying about 13,000 homes and other residential properties.For those who had insurance, it’s often not enough to cover the costs of cons...

item.title: Tin Can phones have been overwhelmed since Christmas
item.description: The company says it’s working to fix a network issue and that paying customers won’t be charged until the devices are reliable once more. The Tin Can phone is designed to be a simple and screen-free way for children to connect with friends and family. But since Christmas morning, when many families unwrapped and installed the retro, landline-style phones, network issues have left many users unable to make or receive calls. ...

item.title: CES 2026 tech you can already buy
item.description: News coming out of CES 2026 might be slowing down, but as of Wednesday we still have writers on the ground, zipping around from hotel suite to Las Vegas convention center to try everything that matters. We've published well over 100 articles, and there's plenty of more content to come, including reviews of stuff we […]

item.title: IKEA's first CES appearance included a $6 Matter smart bulb
item.description: I know IKEA is all about small, efficient spaces, but their meeting room inside the Venetian during the company’s first-ever CES was the same size as my (not large) living room. Plenty of people were as excited as I was to see what the Swedish designers brought with them to the show and the room was thick with humans. A bowl full of BELÖNING bars helped ease my mounting claustrophobia and I was able to check out the new smart home lineup. Like most things IKEA, the 21 Matter-compatible smart home devices are simple, sleek and silly affordable. They include a $6 smart bulb, an $8 smart plug, a ...

item.title: The best hi-fi kit we saw at CES 2026: an iconic turntable updated, Edifier's first eARC active speakers, and much more
item.description: Cambridge's first ever bookshelf stereo speakers, portable Fender Bluetooth options and Victrola's, er, soundbase (yes really).
